marketNews.title: Superbank Said to Begin Measuring Investor Interest for IPO
marketNews.content:
Bloomberg reported that PT Super Bank Indonesia (Superbank) has begun measuring investor interest for an IPO on the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX), with the company planning investor education meetings from 6-17 October 2025. Seventy percent of the IPO proceeds will be used by Superbank as working capital for credit disbursement, while the remainder will fund capital expenditures including the development of systems and information technology products.

Bloomberg noted that CLSA Sekuritas will act as joint global coordinator, while CNBC Indonesia reported that CLSA Sekuritas and Mandiri Sekuritas will serve as underwriters for the IPO.

The Superbank IPO plan first appeared in a Bloomberg report in January 2025, which mentioned that the company targeted IPO proceeds of USD 200-300 million with a valuation of USD 1.5-2 billion, implying an offering of 10-20% of total shares. Bloomberg at that time said the IPO plan was still under consideration and the target proceeds and valuation could change at any time.

According to the company’s website, current shareholders include Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK) via PT Elang Media Visitama (31.11%), Grab via PT Kudo Teknologi Indonesia (19.16%), A5-DB Holdings (11.52%) and GXS Bank (12%), KakaoBank (9.95%), Singtel Alpha Investments (8.46%).

In 1H25, Superbank recorded a net profit of IDR 20.1 billion (vs. a loss of IDR 188 billion in 1H24), supported by a rise in Net Interest Income to IDR 667.6 billion (+171% YoY) as Net Interest Margin increased to 10.2% (vs. 8.1% in 1H24).

marketNews.title: Government Hands Over Seized Assets Worth Rp6-7 Trillion to TINS
marketNews.content:
The government on Monday (6 Oct) handed over seized state assets in the tin sector, valued at IDR 6-7 trillion, to PT Timah (TINS). The assets – comprising six tin smelters and raw mineral assets – were seized in a corruption investigation last year. President Prabowo Subianto noted that the estimated value does not include rare-earth elements, so the total could be much higher.

Shareholder Bumi Resources Minerals (BRMS) saw Van Eck Associates Corporation purchase approximately 50.5 million BRMS shares at an average price of IDR 838.2 per share on 30 Oct 2025, valuing the transaction at about IDR 42.3 billion. After the transaction, Van Eck’s direct ownership rose from ~4.99% to ~5.03%.

Bloomberg reported that Bank Mandiri (BMRI) has disbursed a loan of IDR 34.5 trillion to labor-intensive industries and MSMEs from a liquidity injection of IDR 55 trillion placed by the government. BMRI’s director Novita Widya Anggraini estimates that credit disbursement could reach 100% by the end of 2025. Previously, Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) said it had disbursed 45% of the liquidity injection.

Chandra Daya Investasi (CDIA) announced that the total transaction value for the purchase of 50.99% of PT Chandra Shipping International (CSI) and PT Marina Indah Maritim (MIM) was about IDR 2.7 trillion. CDIA had previously announced the deal in April 2025. After the transaction, CDIA’s ownership in CSI and MIM rose from 49% to 99.9%.

PT Multi Artha Pratama, the controlling shareholder of Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua (PANI), sold roughly 178.2 million PANI shares on 6 Oct 2025 at an average price of IDR 14,075 per share, raising about IDR 2.5 trillion to increase public ownership. After the transaction, its stake fell from 89.93% to 88.88%.

Astra Otoparts (AUTO) plans to distribute an interim dividend for FY 2025 of about IDR 284.4 billion or IDR 59 per share, implying a dividend yield of ~2.5% as of the Monday close (6 Oct). The dividend is payable on 24 Oct, with record-date 14 Oct.

First Resources Limited, the controlling shareholder of Austindo Nusantara Jaya (ANJT), bought roughly 159.2 million ANJT shares on 3 Oct 2025 at an average price of IDR 1,813 per share, a total of about IDR 289 billion, as part of a mandatory tender offer. After the transaction, First Resources’ stake rose from 91.17% to 95.92%.

Barito Renewables Energy (BREN), via its subsidiary Star Energy Geothermal, announced that its geothermal capacity increased to 910.3 MW following the completion of a US$22.5 million retrofit of units 4, 5 and 6 at the Salak PLTP. The retrofit added 7.7 MW, exceeding the initial 7.2 MW target and is part of BREN’s plan to add over 100 MW through new units and capacity expansions in the coming years.

marketNews.title: Hot Topics
marketNews.content:
OPEC+ on Sunday (5 Oct) decided to raise oil production by 137,000 barrels per day starting November 2025 to regain market share, a lower increase than earlier expectations. Bloomberg had earlier reported OPEC+ was considering a rise of up to ~500,000 barrels per day to accelerate recovery. Reuters noted the increase brings OPEC+ output to 2.7 million barrels per day since early 2025, about 2.5% of global demand.

Spot gold rose 1.5% to US$3,950 per troy ounce on Monday (6 Oct), hitting an intraday all-time high, driven by safe-haven demand amid U.S. budget uncertainty and expectations of Fed rate cuts.

Bitcoin reached a new all-time high of US$125,689 on Sunday (5 Oct) before slipping to US$124,118 on Monday (6 Oct). The rally followed strong inflows into Bitcoin ETFs and a supportive U.S. policy stance.

Bloomberg reported that TikTok shared aggregate user data from the August 2025 national protests with the Indonesian government to avoid a licence suspension after the regulator temporarily froze TikTok’s electronic system provider licence on 3 Oct. The ministry said the data is aggregated and cannot be used to track individuals, and the focus will shift to online gambling.

BBCA director Santoso bought 100,000 BBCA shares at an average price of IDR 7,500 on 3 Oct, a transaction worth IDR 750 million, raising his direct holding to about 0.003%.

Bisnis reported that minority shareholder of Merdeka Gold (EMAS), PT Elias Aldana Manajemen, will transfer its 0.81% stake in EMAS to a third party. The company has not commented.

MDIY’s director Rika Juniaty Tanzil told Kontan that the firm added 177 new stores by the end of August 2025, about 66% of the 2025 target of 270 new stores, with capex of IDR 400 billion in 1H25.

Geoprima Solusi (GPSO) clarified to the IDX that a majority-share acquisition by a prospective investor is planned within three months, without disclosing transaction value or investor identity.

tickerNews.title: Superbank IPO – CLSA and Mandiri Sekuritas Appointed as Underwriters
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that CLSA Sekuritas will act as joint global coordinator for Superbank’s upcoming IPO, with CLSA and Mandiri Sekuritas serving as underwriters. The IPO is expected to raise USD 200-300 million, representing 10-20% of the company’s shares, with 70% of proceeds earmarked for working-capital credit disbursement and the remainder for capital expenditures on systems and IT products.
